intro: Evolvulus sericeus var. elongatus, commonly known as the silky morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It is characterized by its delicate, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from pale blue to deep violet. The plant has hairy, slender stems and heart-shaped leaves with a silvery sheen. It thrives in warm climates and is often cultivated as an ornamental plant. Its rapid growth and ability to climb make it a popular choice for gardeners seeking a quick blooming addition.
